document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of Iranian Gonatopodinae (Hymenoptera, Dryinidae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of Iranian Gonatopodinae (Hymenoptera, Dryinidae), with description of a new species

bibRefCitation.author: Ponomarenko, N. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ponomarenko, N. G. (1970) [New species of dryinids (Hymenoptera, Dryinidae) in the European areas of the USSR]. Entomologicheskoe Obozrenie, 49 (2), 423 - 433. [in Russian]

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description ( ♀ ). Fully winged ( Figs 3F , 5A ), length 2.62–3.12 mm . Color. Head testaceous, usually with brown spot on vertex; antenna, pronotum and mesoscutum testaceous; lateral side of mesoscutellum, metanotum and metapectal-propodeal complex black (except distal apex of metapectal-propodeal complex yellow); metasoma yellowish brown, with first tergite partly black and transversal brown bands; legs testaceous. Color variability: Female specimen collected from Zabol-Nimrooz (Nim-229, DPPZ): antenna testaceous; mesoscutum-mesoscutellar suture and mesoscutellum yellowish and/or black; metanotum shiny, smooth, yellowish and black; mesopleuron shiny and smooth, mainly black, with narrow anterior yellowish part. Head ( Figs 3 A–3C). Shiny, unsculptured; ocellar triangle strongly isosceles; POL=1, OL=4, OOL=7; occipital carina absent; frons with median keel extended between ocelli; palpal formula 5/2.
Mesosoma
( Figs 1A , 3 D–3G, 3I, 5A). Pronotum crossed by transversal impression, with collar and lateral regions shiny and unsculptured; disc dull and granulated; posterior edges of pronotum not produced into lobes directed towards tegulae; mesoscutum shiny, weakly punctate; mesoscutellum shiny, smooth, weakly punctate; metanotum reduced, short; metapectal-propodeal complex reticulate rugose, without longitudinal keels; forewing with one brown transversal band; protrochanters approximately four times as long as wide; enlarged claw with one subapical tooth and 4–5 lamellae; protarsomere 5 with one row of 7–11 lamellae; apex with group of 6–11 lamellae; tibial spurs 1/0/1.

Description. ( ♂ ). Fully winged ( Figs 4E , 5B ), length 1.37 mm . Color. Head black, except yellow mandible; antenna brown; mesosoma black; metasoma reddish-brown; legs testaceous. Head ( Figs 4 A–4C): Antennomere 3 more than three times as long as wide; head shiny, unsculptured; occipital carina complete; frons without median keel; palpal formula 4/2.
Mesosoma
( Figs 4 D–4F, 5B). Mesoscutum setose, weakly granulate; mesoscutellum and metanotum shiny, unsculptured; metapectal-propodeal complex reticulate rugose, without longitudinal keels; forewing without brown transversal band; tibial spurs 1/1/2. Genitalia ( Figs 4G , 20A ). Dorsal process of paramer every short, pointed and transverse.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Redrawn chelae of Gonatopodinae Kieffer (from Olmi, 1984 ): A.
Echthrodelphax tauricus Ponomarenko, 1970
, from Sciolze (Italy); B.
Gonatopus camelinus Kieffer, 1904
, from S. Cruz de la Palma (Canaries); C.
Gonatopus clavipes ( Thunberg, 1827 )
, from Kuusamo (Russia); D.
Gonatopus distinguendus Kieffer, 1905
, from El Pardo (Spain).

FIGURE 2. Redrawn chelae of Gonatopodinae (from Olmi, 1984 ): A.
Gonatopus iranicus Olmi, 1984
, holotype; B.
Gonatopus lunatus Klug, 1810
, from Fontainebleau (France); C.
Gonatopus opsiicida Rakhshani & Olmi
sp. nov. ,
holotype; D.
Haplogonatopus apicalis Perkins, 1905
, from Kalugomuwa (Sri Lanka).
